message.content:
{"steps":[{"output":"\lim_{x \to 0+} f(x)","explanation":"Step 1 [Right-hand limit at x=0]:
- As \(x\) approaches 0 from the right, the function \(f(x)\) approaches the value 2. Therefore, \(\lim_{x \to 0+} f(x) = 2\)."},{"output":"\lim_{x \to 1-} f(x)","explanation":"Step 2 [Left-hand limit at x=1]:
- As \(x\) approaches 1 from the left, the function \(f(x)\) approaches the value 1. Therefore, \(\lim_{x \to 1-} f(x) = 1\)."},{"output":"\lim_{x \to 0+} f(x) - \lim_{x \to 1-} f(x) = 2 - 1 = 1","explanation":"Step 3 [Subtraction of limits]:
- Calculate the difference: \(\lim_{x \to 0+} f(x) - \lim_{x \to 1-} f(x) = 2 - 1 = 1\)."}],"final_answer":"\MC: boxed{4}"}
